p: However for ACE2, 3,5-Di-O-galloylshikimic acid has the 3 rd lowest MM-GBSA dG binding energy of −51.7 Kcal/mol with docking score of −11.16 kcal/mol. From the docked poses inside ACE2 catalytic site, it can be concluded that oxygen of the carboxylate was found to interact with HIE 505 and HIE 345 through hydrogen bonding and with ARG 273 through non-covalent ionic interaction (salt bridge). The hydroxyls of the benzoyl moiety were displaying hydrogen bonding interaction with the TYR 127 and GLU 406. HIE 345 of the side chain was involved in the π-π stacking interaction with one of the benzoyl ring ( Figure 4(iv)). The docking score of all the screened natural secondary metabolites is shown in Figure 5.
